Name: CN III Oculomotor
Fuction: midbrain; eye motion (during gaze), eyelid elevation

Name: CN V Trigeminal
Fuction: pons; motor control of jaw/ somatosensation from face and tongue
Role in swallowing: motor control for mastication in oral prep phase and oral sensory feedback in oral phrase

Name: CN VII Facial
Fuction: pons; motor control of face and lips/ taste
Role in swallowing: bolus containment and tongue sensory input in oral prep phase

Name: CN IX Glossopharnygeal
Fuction: medulla; motor control of pharynx/ somatosensation from tongue, pharynx (gag reflex), saliva, taste
Role in swallowing: sensory trigger for pharyngeal phase and elevates the pharynx

Name: CN X Vagus
Fuction: medulla; motor control of pharynx and larynx (gag reflex), motor control of tongue/ somatosensation and visceral sensation from parts of pharynx and larynx, taste
Role in swallowing: motor innervation to soft palate elevation, pharyngeal contraction, and laryngeal closure in pharyngeal phase; sensory innervation to the larynx and pharynx in pharyngeal phase

Name: CN XI Accessory
Fuction: medulla; muscles of neck and shoulders

Name: CN XII Hypoglossal
Role in swallowing: posterior tongue depression in oral preparatory phase and tongue base retraction in pharyngeal phase
